  • monday
    • WITCH.HUNT
      DJ: Bryce Prewitt
      Rock and roll's sole defining feature is its singular ability to simultaneously seduce, enrapture, terrorize, and destroy, a skill near solely reserved for the work of the supernatural. It is no surprise, then, that rock and roll's ascension as the greatest artform of the 20th century, not to mention the most American, was met with the same outrage and hysteria of the American witch trials while its purveyors were persecuted as such; likewise, it is no surprise that generation after generation of misfits and the straightlaced alike have come to embrace its most dark art. Grab your weapon(s) of choice -- whether they be your pitchforks and your torches, your leather jackets and your switchblades, or your dancing shoes and your favorite bowling shirt -- and join us on this most spectacular Witch Hunt of them all in search of both the damned hiding in plain sight and those unknown, those forgotten, those cast aside, and those erroneously relegated to the catacombs of the historic dead.
    • Andrew Dietz’s Show

    • Chi Talk Sports
      DJ: Jon Zaghloul

    • Rough Edges
      DJ: Rishabh Agarwal
      A curation of hazy, distorted lofi house tracks exploring a variety of moods and emotions contained in its muffled kicks, fuzzy synths, obscure samples, and cassette noise. The rough textures of the intentionally ‘dirty’ sound emulate the sounds of Chicago deep house on vinyl creating atmospheric dance music.

    • Radio Salsa Clásica con El Caobo
      DJ: El Caobo

    • Musical Theatre for Liberal Arts Majors
      DJ: Kenjiro Lee
      A show specifically dedicated to playing songs from musicals, that art form where people sing, dance, and act, often at the same time! Check back every week for a new themed set of showtunes, as well as occasional interviews with theater artists in the Chicago area!

    • * Barista-Core
      alternating with
      Signal Two
      DJs: Xander Gonzalez or Sam Dubensky
      You're in your favorite local cafe, getting your morning coffee and bantering with the fashionable yet somewhat awkward barista you see almost every morning. To your surprise, he says that he has a gift for you and pulls a mixtape cassette tape out of his front pocket. "For you," he says, and you take the tape titled "American Aquarium Drinker." "Thank you," you say with a smile, and excuse yourself from the cafe to continue on your hasty morning commute. Heading down the highway you hit a patch of traffic and notice the mixtape starring up at you from the passenger seat where you placed it. "I wonder what could be on it", you think to yourself, and decide to pop it in the grimy, seldom used cassette player built into your beaten yet resilient 2002 sedan. You turn up the volume and for the next hour you are transported by the sonic vibrations to a world of pure caffeination, of pure barista-core. This is that mixtape.
      alternating with
      What do you think of when I say "psychedelic rock?" Long-haired drugged-out dudes jamming out incoherently in the 60s? Some of those descriptors might still be true, but psychedelic rock is back today in many different flavors all around the globe. Tune into "Signal Two" to hear how the genre is being redefined.

    • Afro-Caribbean Connections, Kizomba LifeStyle Radio
      DJ: Kimani
      My Genre is Afro-Music like: 1. (Kizomba, Semba and Afro-House) this is from Angola. 2. (Soukous) from the Congo. 3. (Afro- Beats) from Nigeria and Kenya. 4. (Caribbean Zouk) from the islands of Guadeloupe and Martinique. 5. (Kompa) from Haiti. 6. (Bachata Tipico) from Dominican Republic.
    • Chicago Is the World
      DJ: Felipe Bomeny
      Chicago is the World is a global music radio program showcasing traditional & contemporary world music, with special attention given to local world music artists, cultural workers, performance artists and more. Join your host Demetrio as we explore various musical genres and stories from around the globe. learn more at http://www.chicagoistheworld.org
    • Relentless Reggae

      DJ: (rotating)

  • wednesday
    • Soundgardner
      DJ: Jontan Gardner
      DJ Jontan picks tracks at their prime ripeness, inspecting for color, aroma, and firmness. Only the sweetest produce is served at this turn-table. Each day’s farm-fresh earfoods include a mélange of (psychedelic) seedless sea cucumbers, tasty (Tropicália) fruit-salad, sauer(Krautrock) on sandwiches, and pan-fried (soul) piccata in a lemon-butter sauce, served on a bed of genetically modified-(experimental rock)fish reduction.

    • * The Groks Science Show
      alternating with
      S.C. Media News and Sports
      DJs: Elise Covic, Forest Gulden, Samantha Thomas, Chenan Zhang, Thomas Stewart or Joseph Phillips
      The Groks Science Show investigates topics in science and technology. Each show features a roundup of current science news, interviews with scientists, technologists, and science authors. Also included are fun science facts!
      alternating with
      Sports, politics, retail, development, and business with veteran news reporter Joseph Phillips of the Hyde Park Herald.  The show's diverse programming features various types of athletes, youth leaders, business owners, and others to discuss in depth topics about the community. S.C. Media provides a voice for the minority, middle class, and upper-class communities of Hyde Park and the City of Chicago to produce a favorable media service for their community through citizen journalism.

    • CTA Radio
      DJs: Pugs Atomz, KMax, Aja the Cover'It'Girl
      CTA Radio started eleven years ago on a trial basis as a collaboration between KMax, Thaione Davis, & Pugs. After a few months of devoted listenership and street popularity, the show became a mainstay at the station where it was a haven for undiscovered and established local talent and an outlet for new music and classic hip-hop/rap. Pugs, Aja the Cover'It'Girl, & DJ KMax bring you playlists that includes more than just one genre. Itâ€™s possible to hear a variety of music ranging from Soul, Broken Beat, House (Progressive), Electronica, to the â€˜Undefinedâ€™ category. During the course of the show, they've had the airwaves graced with interviews of legend as well as local artists. There is also a â€˜rantâ€™ or social commentary that is always open for discussion throughout the show. Topics can range from new technology/electronics to politics--local and abroad--or just random thoughts that crosses their minds. This show is definitely a weekly treat!

    • ALL Show
      DJ: Allen L. Linton II
      Chicago is a sports city and ALL Sports with Allen L. Linton II is a Chicago sport's talk show. Tune in for engaging discussions of sports issues and off the field. Sports clichés meet sabermetrics. We love our teams but hate publicly financed stadiums. Listeners can always call the show to bring their ideas, questions, and attitude. More analysis, fewer hot takes.
    • Radical Minds
      DJs: Erin Hagood, Stephanie Gomez
      Radical Minds investigates the interlocking political, economic and social problems facing modern society for a ruthless critique of everything existing. We are an ongoing discussion of activists, academics and intellectuals on issues pertinent to the left--past, present and future.
    • Borzoi Peace Vigil
      DJ: DJ Late Night Cheeseburger
      All songs appearing on this show are fictitious. Any resemblance to real music, living or dead, is purely coincidental. In the ocean-going lane, dream sharks nudge moxie bottles into the shred zone. Irreparable loss.
    • Romanticas Mexicanas y mas
      DJ: DJ El Cachorro
      Join DJ el Cachorro for your weekly fill of music from our friend and neighbor from the south. Music from different regions and covering different topics, but you can always expect some (Hopeless) romanticism. We have music to suit you and how you’re feeling from week to week.
    • Music Around the World
      DJ: Marta
      Marta's meandering musical magical-mystery mind weaves together the sounds of (and interesting facts about) all sorts of music from all over the globe -- from rare field recordings of long-ago isolated tribes in faraway places to contemporary urban pop songs from all continents. Sometimes she has in-studio or phone chats with musicians, composers, producers. Also word about live performances in the Chicago area (and often offers of free tickets) plus info about ethnic festivals, films, exhibitions, and other presentations.

The Show is Hosted by James Earl Bonez who is a member of the legendary South Side Hip Hop group PCP Angel Dust Highruallahz. While listening to the show you will hear reggae/hiphop/r&b/PoliticalSatire. We have guest DJs and specialize in Chicago HipHop. We definately support Chicago Artist.

    • Calypso Cavalcade
      DJ: Randolph
      Calypso Cavalcade, Music of Trinidad & Tobago West Indies, is Chicago's only and longest to date Soca/Calypso radio show. A blend of Soca/Ragga/Calypso/Chutney/Rapso/Social Comentary/Steel Drum, the music presented in a non stop party format. More music less talk -- definitely setting the mood for all night partying.

    • * Morning Jazz
      alternating with
      The Laws of Jazz
      DJs: Michele Drayton or Andy Laws
      No Description
      alternating with
      Jazz at its best, with flavorful commentaries and insightful, thought-provoking informational tidbots. Laws is a law unto himself: relentless in his presentation of top-notch jazz and extremely knowledgeable of the musicians that present the sound.
    • Jazz Rapp with the Impressario Al Carter-Bey
      DJ: Al Carter Bey
      The impressario - the musical host of over 30 years of jazz radio experience. The host with a musical library of 30,000 recordings; keeping the musical history of jazz alive; jazz being america's only orginal art form, as the American Classical Music within the idiom of jazz". if your musical tastes vary and jazz pleases you the most join the impressario al carter-bey.
    • * Journey Into Jazz
      alternating with
      Richard’s Show
      DJs: Brenda Philips and Linda Hall (the Twins) or Richard
      Journey into Jazz focuses on the popular sounds of jazz and the journey that the current local musicians take to personalize their sound. Gentle Smooth Lady Phillips dedicates most of her show to uplifting local artists by playing their recordings (usually renditions of jazz standards). Phillips also conducts regular interviews with local celebrities and keeps her listening community informed of all the local happenings. She also often has free giveaways for exciting events.

    • Souled and New
      DJ: Julia
      Do you need more soul in your life? Here, we believe the answer is always yes, bringing you a balanced diet of soul, Â Stax,Motown, girl group, Wall of Sound, and everyfunk in between (Egyptian Shumba included). We'll also trace the genres to today's music, linking the old with the new, the classics with the rediscovered gems. So, tune in, find out that new dance craze, and get down.
